report.title: Why Drink It?
report.author: patience
report.bodytext: I purchased two bundles of dries poppy pods from a well Known /n nursery and crafts store recently, and despite the poppy tea /n methods I've been reading about, it just doesn't appeal to me. /n Where codeine extractions from acetamiophen products leaves little /n alternative, poppy pods can be dealt with differently. I don't /n like wasting a useful substance... or puking, for that matter. /n /n At least forty pods were crushed and dumped into an electric /n fryer pot with enough water to 'float' the matter freely. /n Setting the dial never above the highest simmer level, I allowed /n the mixture to heat for an hour or so, mixing periodically. /n /n Next, I poured the contents through a strainer into a bowl and then /n poured the cleaned liquid back into the fryer and let most of the /n water content to simmer away until thick but still pourable. /n I carefully poured the extract into a metal measuring cup and /n left it on one of those electric coffee cup warmers until it's /n consistancy was gooey, like peanut butter. There was an adequate /n amount of nicely dried 'tar' around the surface edges of the /n measuring cup to enjoy in a pipe right away. I placed the cup in /n a cool place, away from light to let the heavy resin continue to /n air-dry. /n /n A few good pipe hits at a time seems to pleasently relax me. /n I recommend the use of a small butane torch for maximum effects.
